summary: This is an email chain from November 2021 regarding juror research for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. It involves a paralegal specialist from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY coordinating with a team to conduct online research on potential jurors proceeding to voir dire, with an attached spreadsheet containing notes on 40 jurors.

persons.name: Paralegal Specialist
persons.context: The sender of the final email in the chain, identified as a Paralegal Specialist at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY), who is coordinating juror research and sharing an attached spreadsheet.

events.title: Juror Research Coordination for Maxwell Trial
events.description: Email coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office team to conduct outside online research on potential jurors for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial voir dire, with a request to research the next 40 jurors.

events.title: Juror Research Notes Shared
events.description: A paralegal specialist shares a completed research spreadsheet on 40 potential jurors and typed voir dire notes with the trial team.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY, 1 Saint Andrew's Plaza
keyFacts: The document is internal correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office during the Ghislaine Maxwell trial in November 2021.
It details active juror research being conducted by the prosecution team, including online searches of potential jurors.
An attached spreadsheet contained research on 40 specific jurors proceeding to voir dire, with highlights indicating starting and ending jurors.
The research was intended to assist with jury selection (voir dire) for the following day.
The correspondence shows the procedural steps taken by the prosecution to investigate potential jurors.
